conclusion: Light source initially positioned to cast shadows A, B, C, and D.
Object casting shadow A is a blue cylindrical object.
Object casting shadow B is a spherical object.
Object casting shadow C is a rectangular object.
Object casting shadow D is a rectangular object with multiple circular indentations.
When the light source moves to the back left, the angle of the light rays changes.
Shadows will shift to the right and forward due to light coming from the back left.
Shadows may become larger because the light rays hit objects at a more oblique angle.
When the light source moves to the back right, the angle of the light rays changes again.
Shadows will shift to the left and forward due to light coming from the back right.
Shadows may become larger due to the more oblique angle of the light rays.
Cylindrical object's shadow will be elongated in the direction of the light source's movement.
Spherical object's shadow will be more circular but may appear slightly elongated depending on the angle.
Rectangular objects' shadows will be elongated in the direction of the light source's movement.
Back left movement causes shadows A, B, C, and D to shift right and forward.
Back left movement may cause shadows to become larger due to oblique angle.
Back right movement causes shadows A, B, C, and D to shift left and forward.
Back right movement may cause shadows to become larger due to oblique angle.
Final answer: Shadows shift opposite to light source's movement and may become larger.
